p: We conducted a survival analysis in three separate stress treatments (drought, mowing, shade) to assess if individuals from native and introduced populations showed differences in mortality rates over time. We found no significant difference between the native and introduced ranges in survival for the drought (χ 2 1 = 2.88), mowing (χ 2 1 = 0.02), and shade (χ 2 1 = 0.13) common gardens using a Cox proportional hazards regression ( Supplemental Table 14; Supplemental Figure 8).
